awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Broadening Participation in GENI Workshop
awd_abstract_narration:
The Global Environment for Network Innovations (GENI) is a nationwide suite of infrastructure supporting experimentation in networking, distributed systems, security, and novel applications. This project supports hosting a set of 5 GENI Regional Workshops (GRW), as well as hosting the GENI Network Innovators Community Event (NICE) workshop.  The intent of both GENI NICE and the GRWs is to continue to broaden the GENI research and experimental user community.

The 2nd NICE workshop will be co-located with the ACM International Conference on emerging Networking EXperiments and Technologies (CoNEXT) in December 2016. GENI NICE is a one day event focusing on presentations and demonstrations by researchers and educators on their use of GENI.
GENI NICE also serves to convene the network systems research community to discuss advances in computing research infrastructure. Each GRW is focused on `hands-on' laboratory education and broadening community outreach; regional events serve to reach underserved faculty and students unable to travel to a less frequently occurring geographically distant event. This proposal requests support for one additional GRW in the fall of 2016 in the Northwestern US, and four more in 2017 at various locations throughout the US.

por.por_cntn:
The Global Environment for Network Innovations (GENI) is an open infrastructure for at-scale networking and distributed systems research and education that spans the United States.

The major goal of this project was to continue GENI's success as a platform for research and education, and to expand more broadly the community using publicly available midscale experimental research infrastructure (MERI) beyond GENI to include the NSF-funded Chameleon and CloudLab cloud testbeds, the Platforms for Advanced Wireless Research (PAWR) projects including COSMOS, POWDER/RENEW, AERPAW, and ARA, as well as the FABRIC testbed,  SAGE, and EduceLab.

Over the years of the project, over twenty events were organized.  These events contributed to the training of over 350 individuals on a wide variety midscale experimental research infrastructure through tutorials at GENI Regional Workshops, GENI Summer Camps, the Chameleon User Meeting, and the MERIF Education Workshop:

Event

Number of Participants Trained

GENI Regional Workshops 2016-2018

248

GENI Summer Camps 2017-2018

42

Tutorials at Chameleon User Meeting 2019

13

MERIF Education Workshop 2019

50

In addition, this project contributed to the professional development of over 580 individuals through the GENI NICE, the MERIT Community Event, and the CNERT and MERIF workshops:

Event

Professional Development

GENI NICE 2016-2017

124

CNERT Workshops 2018-2023

207

MERIT Community Event 2019

40

MERIF Workshops 2020, 2022, 2023

210

Over the life of this project, we have contributed to the training and professional development of over 900 individuals.
